{"step_by_step_thinking": "The Curve of Spee is defined as the curvature of the mandibular occlusal plane beginning at the canine and following the buccal cusps of the posterior teeth, continuing to the terminal molar. This curve is also aligned so that a continuation of this arc would extend through the condyles. Therefore, the curve that passes through the cusps of all the posteriors and reaches to the condyle is the Curve of Spee.", "answer_choice": "D. Curve of spee."}
